author: Special Correspondent
text:
Lieutenant Governor A.K. Singh and Chief Minister N. Rangasamy on Saturday paid floral tributes to the statue of Mahatma Gandhi on his death anniversary.

The occasion was observed on behalf of Government of Puducherry on Saturday at the venue of the Mahatma Gandhi Square on the Beach Road. Assembly Speaker V. Sabapathy and Ministers P. Rajavelu, N.G. Pannirselvam and T. Thiagarajan offered floral tributes to the father of the nation. Chief Secretary Manoj Parida and Inspector General of Police Praveer Ranjan participated in the programme. Patriotic songs were also sung by teachers of Jawahar Bal Bhavan followed by the gathering observing a two-minute silence.

A delegation of Congress leaders led by former Union Minister of State V. Narayanasamy, former Chief Minister and Leader of Opposition V. Vaithilingam and Pradesh Congress Committee president A. Namassivayam paid homage.
title: Leaders pay tributes to Mahatma Gandhi
